list_definition.definition: a guard or guards to protect (especially an important person)

list_ex_of_english: When he was told that he would get a bodyguard, he joked about it to friends and to his wife.
If all we are looking for is protection, we could pay a private security firm to act as a bodyguard for us, individually and collectively.
Bodyguards now guard the raffle stall whenever the games are held.
For this reason there is a bodyguard of people, even in politics, who in the interests of their clients want to prevent stricter laws.
We should leave bodyguards and come back to the amendment.
The interviewer looked at the bodyguards of the prince who were very smartly dressed.
He told me how much he had come to like and respect his personal bodyguards.
I was looked upon as the leader of his bodyguard.
